meanings.definition: A green or blue pigment made by adding copper to a solution of ammonium carbonate.
meanings.sent1: The artist used verditer to paint the leaves of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The sky had a beautiful verditer hue as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child mistook verditer for a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a verditer intensity, reflecting her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The verditer pigment brought life to the dull canvas, transforming it into a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A green or blue color resembling verdigris.
meanings.sent1: The old book had faded to a lovely verditer shade.
meanings.sent2: The ocean shimmered with a verditer sheen under the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The room was painted in a peculiar verditer tone, making it stand out.
meanings.sent4: His words had a verditer quality, leaving a lasting impression on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The verditer color of the dress matched perfectly with her eyes, creating a striking look.
